rounds.comments: (Alex Trebek: There are two words in each correct response.  The first one has 2 syllables, the second word has 1.)

clues.text: If you're caught with your "hand in" this dessert container, you've probably just taken a bribe
A list of students who have earned good grades, it's also called the dean's list
Meant to improve public health, these disposable drinking vessels got their name in 1919
Vexing look thought capable of bringing bad luck to the person it was directed at
This piece of furniture proverbially helped actresses get movie roles
The Nizam Satlada is a 7-stringed necklace of India with hundreds of these marine gems strung on it
The 182-carat Star of Bombay, one of these blue gems, inspired a brand of gin
The 3,107-carat Cullinan Diamond, the largest gem diamond ever known, was presented to this British king in 1907
One of the largest faceted gems is the 22,892-carat "American Golden" one of these November birthstones
The Chalk emerald ring & the Mackay emerald necklace both showcase gems from this South American country
"The Andy Griffith Show" was set in this North Carolina town
She moonlights from "Glee" to host "Hollywood Game Night"
Woody Harrelson & Matthew McConaughey are cops on a 17-year hunt for a serial killer on this HBO series
The desperation may be permanent on this lane now that "Desperate Housewives" has been canceled
Mrs. Garrett was housemother to Jo, Tootie, Natalie & Blair at the Eastland School on this sitcom
In 1676 Nathaniel Bacon burned to the ground this first permanent English settlement in America
In 1851 The New York Times was founded to represent the views of this party that didn't last much longer
On Oct. 3, 1993 rebels shot down 2 Blackhawk helicopters in this country; 18 U.S. soldiers were killed
This 1972 pick for running mate told McGovern he had been treated for depression & withdrew from the race
On July 10, 1962 this satellite was placed in orbit & soon began relaying TV pictures between the U.S. & Europe

rounds.comments: (Alex Trebek: Those two letters coming up in that order.)

clues.text: One postulated sequence of events, hopefully "best-case"
A leather case for carrying important documents
A relationship between 2 values; Wall Streeters talk about the "P/E" one
An organizer & sponsor of public entertainments such as concerts or plays
An official representative of the pope
There are 20 in the first set of these you get, then--bonus! you get 32
A woman is born with more than a million of these but only about 400 will ever be released
Made up of many bones fused together, it protects the cerebrum, the hippocampus & other vital parts
This soft, purplish organ with sinusoids may be removed if one has cancer of the lymphatic system
This main artery of the thigh ends just above the knee
QC is the postal abbreviation for this Canadian province, the largest in area
Put MB on your letter & it'll go to this province that could be called the Land of 38,000 Lakes
One of the 4 original provinces, it's NB
This province with lots of dinosaur bones is SK
NU is new & stands for this territory created in 1999

rounds.comments: (Alex: And finally, in each correct response, the letter "E" will follow the "D".)

clues.text: From the Latin for "faithful", it's loyalty or faithfulness to one's spouse
Wine is often poured from the bottle into this decorative container
This decorative art with needle & thread includes such stitches as flat, knotted & looped
This term refers to a student at a military school such as West Point who is training to become an officer
From the Latin for "to shackle the feet", this verb means to hinder or obstruct progress
NASA has found an Earthlike planet within a "habitable zone"--the area in a star system where this could exist in liquid form
In 2013 Caltech scientists announced there are more than 100 billion planets in this alone--about one per star
The first Earth-size exoplanets were found by the NASA satellite launched in 2009 & named for this 17th c. German astronomer
In 1992 the first exoplanets were found orbiting one of these rotating stars that emit regular bursts of radiation
In 1995 astronomers confirmed the first exoplanet orbiting a sunlike star, in this "equine" constellation
San Antonio mayor Julian Castro delivered this at the 2012 Democratic Convention
A thingamajig; its usage dates back 100 years
This detachable men's shirt front started to become popular in the 19th century
A tough way to get off a drug
If a person purchases a business that is fully equipped & ready to open, it is said to be this
Last name of Secretary No. 3--the fort named for him played a "key" role in "The Star-Spangled Banner"
Pierce's War Secretary, he soon ended up in a war, all right... with the United States
A son of this president worked for Garfield & later became a wealthy corporate lawyer
Nice balancing act!  This future prez was Madison's Secretary of State & War at the same time
Secretary during the Civil War, he died 4 days after Grant appointed him to the Supreme Court

rounds.category: THAT USED TO BE A THING

clues.text: Clark Kent would have trouble today finding one of these to change in, as AT&T & other companies have abandoned them
"A Feathered River Across the Sky" is a 2014 book about this creature that once made up over 1/4 of North America's birds
The landmark "Old Man of the Mountain" collapsed in 2003, but it's still on license plates of this state
On June 26, 2013 the Supreme Court said this act was "unconstitutional as a deprivation of the equal liberty of persons"
Formed in 1930, this 3-letter airline got absorbed by American in 2001

rounds.text: According to Nielsen, it's the night of the week on which the most people are watching prime time TV
